t: Elastic Fabric Adapter — Amazon Web Services
s: Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA) is a network interface for Amazon EC2 instances that enables customers to run applications requiring high levels of inter-node communications at scale on AWS. Its custom-built operating system (OS) bypass hardware interface enhances the performance of inter-instance ...

t: Elastic Fabric Adapter for AI/ML and HPC workloads on Amazon EC2 - Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
s: Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA) is a network device that you can attach to your Amazon EC2 instances to accelerate Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine learning (ML), and High Performance Computing (HPC) workloads.

t: Get started with EFA and MPI for HPC workloads on Amazon EC2 - Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
s: Learn how to launch an EFA and MPI-enabled cluster for HPC workloads on Amazon EC2

t: Elastic Fabric Adapter - AWS Batch
s: The job definition must include a devices member with hostPath set to /dev/infiniband/uverbs0 to allow the EFA device to be passed through to the container. If containerPath is specified, it must also be set to /dev/infiniband/uverbs0.

t: Run Training with EFA - Amazon SageMaker AI
s: SageMaker AI provides integration with EFA devices to accelerate High Performance Computing (HPC) and machine learning applications. This integration allows you to leverage an EFA device when running your distributed training jobs. You can add EFA integration to an existing Docker container ...

t: EFA is now mainstream, and that’s a Good Thing | Amazon Web Services
s: November 11, 2021 - We have recently launched three new Amazon EC2 instances types enabled with Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA), our network interface for Amazon EC2 instances that enables customers to run applications requiring high levels of inter-node communications at scale on AWS.
